author: Globe Newswire
title: Infographic: What Do Medical Students Think About Healthcare Today?
text:
athenahealth, Inc. announced results from the 10th annual Epocrates Future Physicians of America survey. The results reveal the opinions of more than 1,000 medical students on medical school training, the future of technology, and industry challenges.
Improved interoperability is imperative: According to medical students, fragmented care is the #1 safety risk for today's patients, underscoring the need for improved and meaningful patient data sharing. Almost all students believe that easily sharing patient records among care teams is critical to improving patient care, yet 44 percent are concerned about the ability to do so within a hospital or practice and 73 percent worry about the ability to share patient information across unaffiliated practices.
